title: Graeme Swann: ‘Playing cricket for England, you can earn £2m a year’
text:
Former England cricket player Graeme Swann retired from professional cricket in 2013. He started his career playing for Northamptonshire in his teens and later played for Nottinghamshire.

He appeared in Strictly Come Dancing last year, and is on tour this autumn with former cricket commentator Henry Blofeld. He lives in Nottinghamshire with his wife, Sarah, and their three children.

How did your childhood affect your attitude towards money?

I grew up in a fairly frugal household in Northamptonshire. My family were very northern – my dad is a Geordie, my mum a Lancastrian. Both grew up with not much money so they were very careful with it. I grew up realising the importance of money. They taught...
description: Former England cricket player Graeme Swann retired from professional cricket in 2013.
